sentences: Kus sa oled? Ma ei tea, kuhu sind viidi
Kes on see, kes sind aitas?
context: 'Sind' is the Estonian partitive singular form of the pronoun 'sina', which means 'you'. It is used as an object in sentences when referring to 'you' in the singular case. This is the accusative/partitive form that follows verbs like nägema (to see), teadma (to know), or aitama (to help).
